htmlContent:
Express.js Guide

Express.js is a lightweight Node.js framework for building REST APIs and server-side applications efficiently. It's fast, minimal, and highly extensible for modern backend development.

Key Features

  • Routing & Middleware for modular apps
  • REST API Development with clean structure
  • Error Handling & Logging
  • Integration with MongoDB/Node.js apps

Best Practices

  • Organize routes & controllers
  • Use middleware for reusable logic
  • Handle errors consistently
  • Write clean, maintainable code
"Express.js allows developers to create scalable server-side apps and APIs with minimal boilerplate."

Example Route

import express from 'express';
const app = express();

app.get('/api/users', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ message: 'Hello from Express!' });
});

app.listen(3000, () => console.log('Server running on port 3000'));

Next Steps

  • Connect Express APIs with MongoDB or other databases
  • Implement authentication & authorization
  • Write tests for routes and middleware
  • Deploy your backend on platforms like Heroku or Render

By following these guidelines, you can build clean, maintainable, and scalable backend applications using Express.js.
